diseases.name: Foot and Mouth Disease
diseases.symptoms: Fever, blisters in mouth and feet, lameness, excessive salivation, reduced appetite
diseases.causes: Viral infection spread through direct contact, contaminated feed, or airborne transmission
diseases.prevention: Vaccination, biosecurity measures, quarantine new animals, avoid contact with infected animals
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, antibiotic treatment for secondary infections, isolation, proper nutrition
diseases.seasonality: All year, peaks in dry season

diseases.name: Mastitis
diseases.symptoms: Swollen udder, abnormal milk (clots, blood), fever, loss of appetite, reduced milk production
diseases.causes: Bacterial infection, poor milking hygiene, contaminated equipment, stress
diseases.prevention: Proper milking hygiene, clean bedding, regular udder health checks, good nutrition
diseases.treatment: Antibiotic treatment, anti-inflammatory drugs, proper milking technique, isolation

diseases.name: Lumpy Skin Disease
diseases.symptoms: Firm nodules on skin, fever, reduced milk production, weight loss, difficulty breathing
diseases.causes: Viral infection transmitted by biting insects, direct contact with infected animals
diseases.prevention: Vaccination, vector control, quarantine new animals, good hygiene
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, antibiotic treatment for secondary infections, good nutrition

diseases.name: Blackleg
diseases.symptoms: Sudden death, lameness, swelling in muscles, fever, depression, loss of appetite
diseases.causes: Bacterial infection from contaminated soil, deep wounds, poor vaccination
diseases.prevention: Vaccination, avoid deep wounds, proper wound care, good hygiene
diseases.treatment: Emergency vaccination, antibiotic treatment, surgical drainage, supportive care
diseases.seasonality: All year, peaks in wet season

diseases.name: Anthrax
diseases.symptoms: Sudden death, bleeding from body openings, high fever, difficulty breathing, swelling
diseases.causes: Bacterial infection from contaminated soil, ingestion of spores
diseases.prevention: Vaccination, avoid contaminated areas, proper carcass disposal, quarantine
diseases.treatment: Immediate veterinary attention, antibiotic treatment, isolation, supportive care
diseases.seasonality: All year, peaks in dry season

diseases.name: Pneumonia
diseases.symptoms: Coughing, difficulty breathing, fever, nasal discharge, reduced appetite, lethargy
diseases.causes: Bacterial or viral infection, poor ventilation, stress, overcrowding
diseases.prevention: Good ventilation, proper nutrition, stress reduction, vaccination, hygiene
diseases.treatment: Antibiotic treatment, anti-inflammatory drugs, good ventilation, supportive care
diseases.seasonality: All year, peaks in cold season

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.symptoms: No symptoms observed, normal behavior, good appetite, normal vital signs
diseases.causes: Good health management, proper nutrition, vaccination, hygiene
diseases.prevention: Continue current health management practices, regular health checks
diseases.treatment: Continue regular health monitoring, maintain good practices

diseases.name: Mange
diseases.symptoms: Itching, hair loss, skin thickening, restlessness, weight loss, skin lesions
diseases.causes: Mite infestation, poor hygiene, overcrowding, stress
diseases.prevention: Regular health checks, quarantine new animals, clean environment, good nutrition
diseases.treatment: Acaricide treatment, environmental cleaning, isolation, supportive care

diseases.name: Ringworm
diseases.symptoms: Circular lesions, hair loss, scaly skin, itching, skin thickening
diseases.causes: Fungal infection, poor hygiene, stress, overcrowding
diseases.prevention: Good hygiene, avoid contact with infected animals, clean environment
diseases.treatment: Antifungal treatment, topical medication, environmental cleaning, isolation

diseases.name: Bloat
diseases.symptoms: Distended abdomen, difficulty breathing, restlessness, excessive salivation, collapse
diseases.causes: Rapid fermentation, gas accumulation, poor feeding management, stress
diseases.prevention: Proper feeding management, avoid sudden diet changes, monitor grazing
diseases.treatment: Emergency treatment, stomach tube, anti-foaming agents, veterinary care
